wikipedia_page.main: Langford Lovell Price (1862–1950) was an English economist, born in London.  He was educated at Trinity College, Oxford, became fellow and treasurer of Oriel in 1888, and was Newmarch lecturer in statistics at University College, London in 1895-96.  In 1897 he was governor of Dulwich College and in 1898 was appointed an examiner in the "Moral Sciences Tripos" at Cambridge.
